definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions

sentences.english: Two and two halves to the city centre, please.
sentences.chinese: 勞駕，買去市中心的兩張全票和兩張半票。

sentences.english: A: Can I cancel this ticket?
They are over age; they can't go half.
sentences.chinese: 他們超齡了，不能買半票。

sentences.english: Can I transfer by this ticket?
The children get into the concert for half-price.
sentences.chinese: 兒童半票就可以聽音樂會。

sentences.english: Children under 5 can travel half fare.
sentences.chinese: 小於五歲的孩子可以買半票。

sentences.english: The young mother face turns red. Then she buys a half ticket.
sentences.chinese: 年輕媽媽臉紅了，於是她又買了張半票。

sentences.english: Can I buy a half-ticket for my child?
sentences.chinese: 我可以給我的小孩買張半票嗎？

sentences.english: School children can travel half fare.
The students were admitted to the concerts at half price.
sentences.chinese: 學生可買半票參加音樂會。

sentences.english: Students get into the concert for half-price.
sentences.chinese: 學生可以買半票去聽音樂會。

definition: not to be charged for admission/(to be admitted) for free/free pass
to buy tickets/(Tw) to buy votes (in an election)
to buy or upgrade a ticket after boarding a train, boat etc/to buy a ticket for a show after having sat down in the theater
evidence (that one can rely on)/grounds (for believing sth)
